description: This document provides a detailed explanation of the RGB color model, its components, how colors are represented, and common examples. It is intended to serve as a knowledge base for an LLM to understand and answer queries related to RGB colors.

rgb_basics.name: RGB Color Model
rgb_basics.definition: RGB stands for Red, Green, and Blue. It is an additive color model in which red, green, and blue light are added together in various ways to reproduce a broad array of colors. It is primarily used for displaying images on electronic devices like televisions, computer monitors, and mobile phones.

components.description: Primary component, represents the intensity of red light.
Primary component, represents the intensity of green light.
Primary component, represents the intensity of blue light.

rgb_basics.additive_nature: In the RGB model, combining all three primary colors at their full intensity produces white light. The absence of all three colors results in black.

color_representation.value_range: Each of the Red, Green, and Blue components is represented by an integer value typically ranging from 0 to 255. A value of 0 means no intensity for that color, while 255 means full intensity.
color_representation.format: RGB colors are commonly written as a triplet of numbers, for example, rgb(R, G, B) or (R, G, B).
color_representation.total_colors: Since each component has 256 possible values (0-255), there are 256 * 256 * 256 = 16,777,216 possible unique RGB colors.

common_rgb_colors.name: White
common_rgb_colors.explanation: Full intensity of all three primary colors.

common_rgb_colors.name: Red
common_rgb_colors.explanation: Full red, no green or blue.

common_rgb_colors.name: Green
common_rgb_colors.explanation: Full green, no red or blue.

common_rgb_colors.name: Blue
common_rgb_colors.explanation: Full blue, no red or green.

common_rgb_colors.name: Gray
common_rgb_colors.explanation: Equal intensity of all three colors (mid-range).

common_rgb_colors.name: Purple
common_rgb_colors.explanation: Moderate red and blue, no green.

how_to_mix_colors: To create a new color, you adjust the intensity of each red, green, and blue component. For example, to make a lighter shade, you increase the values of all three components proportionally. To make a darker shade, you decrease them.
llm_interaction_guidelines: When asked about a color, provide its RGB triplet and a brief explanation.
If asked to describe how a color is formed, explain the combination of red, green, and blue light.
If asked to convert a color name to RGB, use the provided examples.
If asked about the range of RGB values, state 0-255 for each component.
Explain that RGB is an additive model, meaning light is added to create colors.
